thread.title: Raw fish gets trendy: 10 restaurants for poke in metro Phoenix
thread.title_full: Raw fish gets trendy: 10 restaurants for poke in metro Phoenix

author: Georgann Yara, Special for The Republic
title: Raw fish gets trendy: 10 restaurants for poke in metro Phoenix
text:
The poke tuna at Kabuki Japanese Restaurant. (Photo: Kabuki Japanese Restaurant) 
If it seems like you're seeing raw fish on a lot of Valley menus, it's because it's one of the hottest trends in the local restaurant scene .
Poke, in particular, is becoming increasingly popular. The Hawaiian dish of seasoned bits of raw fish also is served in a bowl with ingredients like rice and vegetables. For diners, a big draw is the ability to customize their poke bowl based on the type of fish and toppings they like.
Whether you're already a fan or a curious novice, here are 10 Valley restaurants that offer something for your level of expertise and culinary adventure.
MORE DINING: These 11 trends will shape what you eat in 2017 | Ahipoki Bowl to open three location in Phoenix | Poki Bar Central joins poke bowl craze | Recipe: Healthful cubed ahi tuna salad 
Match Cuisine & Cocktails The Match poke bowl ($15) brings together Bakkafrost salmon belly, wild-caught yellowfin tuna, sushi rice, diced Hass avocado, fresh wakame seaweed, carrots and pickled cucumber. The combo is finished off in a zesty citrus ponzu and green onion garnish.
Details: FOUND:RE Phoenix, 1100 N. Central Ave. 602-875-8080, matchphx.com .
No hokey in this this poke, just lots of delicious and fresh flavors. #PokeBowl #FuelYourFlavor
